column3: Doesn't seem to work for me... (the immature transactions are simply not shown)\n

I was only looking at immature transactions before, not the balance; i must have misread.

The immature balance seems to work fine with this patch; however, newly generated mining transactions are not shown, while the transaction counter is updated.
I think WalletModel::getNumTransactions() is a bit too simple...but, I didn't touch that.\n
ACK\n
There's really no reason Bitcoin-Qt should be setting fonts/colours in most cases. Let the user configure their OS's font selection...\n
Needs rebasing. Sipa broke everything using locks. >_<\n
Rebased.\n
ACK\n

It would be nice to move as many settings as possible into the ui file without breaking support for older Qt versions, see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/1212

I also have been told, that "Monospace" is only for addresses and not for BTC amount labels.
I'd like to merge this. Can you rebase one more time?\n
General ACK, but it would be nice to update  and reflect my suggestions, too keep things easier in the source and use the XML files as much as possible.\n
No worries :) I'll have a shot at it now. Just have to wrangle this new mac into submission.\n
Ok rebased and cleaned up UI stuff. Please check the layout still looks and acts as you'd like.\n

Is this rebased agains the current master? Sorry to ask, but the changes to overviewpage.cpp / overviewpage.ui look somehow weird in the diff. It seems you change QFormLayout to QGridLayout, but to only add 2 labels...?

Edit: It should only add labelImmatureText and labelImmature to the XML, no?

I do have my disagreements with git, but I'm pretty sure it's against the current master. I changed it to a grid layout because when I removed the HTML from the 'wallet' label at the top of that section, it was no longer centered. The grid layout looked like it worked for me...but I've only tried it on a mac.\n
I would feel much better to only add the labels and I saw at least 2 parts, that are not in the current master, but show up in your diff ... strange.\n
No you're right - missed a fetch. I'll redo it. Sorry.\n
The overviewpage.cpp is fine now.\n
I started with the fresh master copy of the xml and just added those two fields. The rest of the changes were done automatically by the editor.\n
As @laanwj is the one, who is able to merge this he should give the final ACK and comment :). Thanks for your work!\n
My pleasure. That should have been much easier.\n
Blerg, needs rebasing again :(\n
Oops we should have merged this first before the (out of sync) stuff...\n
But at least we now have a clean ui-file, should be pretty easy to just add the 2 labels in.\n
Rebased again.\n

Finally merged...

Agreed with @sje397, the ui file output is just a data file, and should be opaque. No need for manually shuffling around xml unless something is broken in the designer and it produces nonfunctional code as a result.

@sje397 Scott, today I observed sth. strange, the displayed Immature balance was displaying a higher value, than it should. In the transaction list the mined ammounts were already displayed as mature, but did still count towards immature. A client restart fixed this, any idea for that?\n

@Diapolo I'll look into it. All I can think of is that perhaps the signal to update those values isn't working correctly. It should update along with the balance above, which should also change when amounts mature.\n

I can't see why that would happen. The signal ('balancedChanged') is called from the wallet model whenever 'updateTransaction' is called...which AFAIK should be called when mined amounts mature. I'll keep looking.\n

This seems to be a more general issue, and applies to the 'unconfirmed' balance as well and not just the 'immature' balance that I added. I just started my client after receiving a 'payout confirmation' email from my pool, and after sync it showed the new transaction in the transaction list as confirmed (8 confirmations) but still showed that amount 'unconfirmed' in the overview. As with your case
Have a look at the discussion in #1475. AFAIK @laanwj is currently working on that general fix.\n
Thanks Philip. Sounds like progress has been made. :)\n
What is the intention of the change here? It looks like it does the same thing...\n
Yes, I mentioned that in the pull req. It's just easier to read imo (laanwj agreed).\n
+1 for easier to read.\n
I wonder how other OSs interpret the Ubuntu font family.\n
It's a bad idea to include another HTML-string which contains invalid HTML and a font only available on Ubuntu. It's an issue already, see: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/945.\n
Agreed. This was there already, but got moved with my window rearrangement (see 'old' line 82 below).\n
setToolTip and setTextInteractionFlags can move to the ui-file and here is that Monospace thing I talked about (you can set bold in the Qt Designer though).\n
This part is not in the master anymore:\nhttps://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/qt/forms/overviewpage.ui\n
And this one was also removed by a commit, so why should it show up here?\n
Looking much better, but what does this do / change?\n
